block.p: Meghan Marie McGrath, the daughter of Linda Ambrosino and the stepdaughter of Lawrence Ambrosino of Saratoga Springs, N.Y., is to be married there today to Alan Lee Bazaar, the son of Susan and Harvey Bazaar of North Caldwell, N.J. Justice Frank B. Williams of State Supreme Court in Saratoga Springs will officiate at the Canfield Casino.

The bride, who will continue to use her name professionally, received a master's degree in acting from the Actors Studio at New School University in May. She graduated from Villanova. Her mother owns two toy stores, G. Willikers in Saratoga Springs and Poofberry's in Kennebunkport, Me. Her stepfather owns a graphics design and advertising agency bearing his name in Saratoga Springs.

The bride, who will continue to use her name professionally, received a master's degree in acting from the Actors Studio at New School University in May. She graduated from Villanova. Her mother owns two toy stores, G. Willikers in Saratoga Springs and Poofberry's in Kennebunkport, Me. Her stepfather owns a graphics design and advertising agency bearing his name in Saratoga Springs.

The bridegroom is a money manager for a private investment office in Stamford, Conn. He graduated from Bucknell and received an M.B.A from New York University. His mother is a board member for the Ovarian Cancer Research Fund. His father retired as a senior partner in PricewaterhouseCoopers, the accounting firm in New York, and was a trustee of New York University Downtown Hospital.
